recommendationsReceived.name: Malkhan Thakur
recommendationsReceived.headline: Business Analyst at Novartis, Studied at IIT (BHU) Varanasi
recommendationsReceived.relation: Nikhil was senior to Malkhan but didn’t manage directly
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is one of the very best among all people I have ever worked with. Wise, clever, brilliant College Senior who can be trusted. He is always capable of adapting to new working environments. Very positive attitude towards work. Nikhil will find a way to weather any storm with a smile. I certainly would recommend him as my college mentor.

recommendationsReceived.name: José Próspero
recommendationsReceived.headline: Uniplaces Ambassador Operations Team
recommendationsReceived.relation: José worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is a true entrepreneur. I met him at the Asia Pacific Innovation Academy and his aim to do more and make things done blew me up. I am sure that I will hear a lot about great things Nikhil will do and if you have the opportunity to work with him, I'm sure you won't regret! He his a true hustler!

recommendationsReceived.name: Jorge Nunez
recommendationsReceived.headline: Analyst at noventic group
recommendationsReceived.relation: Nikhil worked with Jorge in the same group
recommendationsReceived.content: I met Nikhil during the Global Entrepreneurship Summer School (GESS) at the Tongji University in Shanghai, China. Nikhil and I were not only roommates, but also team members. Together we worked on one of the worlds biggest environmental problems: consumption. With the subtopic waste, we focused on abandoning plastic in the usage of food delivery packaging. Our team of five members found a sustainable and scalable way to solve not only that problem, but also to reduce the overall leftover waste by 25%!!! The business model that we built was profitable and would change the food delivery experience of every single user. Nikhil did not only strongly commit into our team work with his broad knowledge about the market and many start-ups, he did also pitch our ideas to investors in the most professional way. All of our team members appreciated the work with Nikhil. During our last days, we had to work almost 20 hours a day in order to finish our pitch. With Nikhil being one of the first team members to come and one of the last members to leave, I know that working over time will never be a problem for him. He focused on delivering the best presentation as possible on time, for which I am very thankful.  I want to use this opportunity to thank Nikhil. With him I did not only met a professional serial entrepreneur with a knowledge from start-ups to various markets, but also won a very good friend. I highly recommend Nikhil to every possible position.

recommendationsReceived.name: Sushant Shekhar
recommendationsReceived.headline: Helping companies recruit faster with Bots
recommendationsReceived.relation: Sushant worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Met Nikhil at Asia Pacific Innovation Academy this summer, Nikhil is a passionate and knowledgeable Entrepreneur who doesn't shy away from challenges. He is always ready to help others with his out-of-the-box thinking as well.

recommendationsReceived.name: Brina Mata
recommendationsReceived.headline: Manager of Operations and Administration at Artveoli, Inc.
recommendationsReceived.relation: Brina managed Nikhil directly
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil has great leadership skills and exudes managerial excellence. He is knowledgeable in marketing, entrepreneurship, web design, and analytics to name a few. He is a definite asset to any team and it was a pleasure working with him.

recommendationsReceived.name: Mads Bering
recommendationsReceived.headline: Business Development Engineer | Game Changer | Optimization Mindset | Tech Enthusiast
recommendationsReceived.relation: Mads worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is a great out-of-the-box thinker - I met him in China, where we had the opportunity to talk about his previous experience and passion in life. I believe Nikhil is a very fast moving reactor when he sees great opportunities. He's warm, always seeking for new knowledge and very pleasant. You can always count for his true feedback of thoughts and he's great at networking.  I hope to get to work with Nikhil again soon, I'm sure he will continue his great path of achievements, especially with his work in ViaSpeak. There is a great vision on bringing speakers and events together.

recommendationsReceived.name: Anzhela Rudenko
recommendationsReceived.headline: Partnerships Project Manager at Weblium| Digital Women 2020 Initiative
recommendationsReceived.relation: Anzhela worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is an amazing entrepreneur who always work hard to get best results of the team work. I Participated in APIA with him, and his start up made a huge development from idea into ready solution in just 3 weeks of work guided by Nikhil Jain.

recommendationsReceived.name: Silvia Chilet Jorge
recommendationsReceived.headline: CFO at Yased.Lab. Young Leader to the UNCTAD Youth Forum 2018. BBA and Law Graduate.
recommendationsReceived.relation: Silvia worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil made the Asia Pacific Innovation Academy (APIA) way easier and collaborative, since he was always ready to listen to problems and give feedbacks to help overcoming difficulties within other teams. Resolutive, courageous and dynamic Nikhil is the kind of team player that is needed around.

recommendationsReceived.name: Mario Robert D'Ambrosio
recommendationsReceived.headline: Helping People in emerging IT areas for disruptive world markets
recommendationsReceived.relation: Mario Robert worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: I have worked with Nikhil during the APIA program and he has inspired me enormously: his motivation for personal success (not financial or public, but actual personal achievement) is outstanding, this makes his learning thrive unstoppable and his work labor professional.  Nikhil is a passionate learner, avid competitor and most of all, great educator. What struck me most was his power to inspire and teach to others.  I am confident any other who has worked with him could relate to this.

recommendationsReceived.name: Aaron Ho
recommendationsReceived.headline: IT Project Manager | Software Developer | Tech Enthusiast | Optimization Mindset
recommendationsReceived.relation: Aaron worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil has been one of the best persons to listen and speak to. His relentless passion towards innovation and growth with his entrepreneurial mindset will surely take him very far in his career. Having talked about the latest trends in Technology and Business on a global scale, I can definitely say that Nikhil could definitely lead his team to success in the future!

recommendationsReceived.name: Alejandra Merit Espi
recommendationsReceived.headline: Business Development Intern at Me.reka Makerspace
recommendationsReceived.relation: Alejandra reported directly to Nikhil
recommendationsReceived.content: I got the opportunity to work with Nikhil at the Asian-Pacific Innovation Academy, and he has a real hero! We made it top 15 because of his great work and guidance to the rest of the team.  You are a really hard worker, and I am sure you will achieve whatever you want.

recommendationsReceived.name: Cillian Burke
recommendationsReceived.headline: Vice Auditor & Head of Entrepreneurship at UCD Investors & Entrepreneurs Society
recommendationsReceived.relation: Cillian worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil initially impressed me by his willingness to learn and complete determination to tackle various challenges during the APIA programme. He is an inquisitive and knowledgable young man who was never afraid to voice his opinion. What I like about Nikhil is that he is very personable but also maintains a level of professionalism at all times. His never say no attitude is a true testament to his character. I particularly enjoyed his new venture Viaspeak and would recommend to others.

recommendationsReceived.name: Nathan Huggins
recommendationsReceived.headline: Account Manager at Facebook
recommendationsReceived.relation: Nathan worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: Very few people I have met have the energy, drive, and determination that Nikhil Jain has.  I met Nikhil at the Asia Pacific Innovation Academy in Shenzhen. Over a three week period he manifested an idea, very close to his heart, into what is now a platform that creates massive value for speakers, ViaSpeak. I know from first have experience that Nikhil has had to overcome many roadblocks to make this platform a reality. This success is a testament to his leadership skills and persistence.  If anyone has the opportunity to work with Nikhil, they should not pass up such an opportunity.

recommendationsReceived.name: Shira Abel
recommendationsReceived.headline: Strategist | Hunter & Bard - Award-Winning Public Relations & Design Agency
recommendationsReceived.relation: Nikhil worked with Shira in the same group
recommendationsReceived.content: I was a Marketing Mentor to Nikhil at APIA. He was a pleasure to work with, listened and reacted accordingly to advice and was a great leader to his team. I look forward to watching him grow his career. I’m sure he’ll accomplish great things.

recommendationsReceived.name: Aditya R.
recommendationsReceived.headline: #thewrongpsycho | Chief Evangelist@HUM | Desi Growth Hacker | Execution and Growth are my forte!
recommendationsReceived.relation: Aditya worked with Nikhil but at different companies
recommendationsReceived.content: If you are looking for a go to guy who has depth in the field of crowd funding, start-ups and community building , Nikhil should be your top choice.  He only speaks of what he has executed. No bogus talks. He adds a lot of value to the team.

recommendationsReceived.name: Murielle Liu
recommendationsReceived.headline: Crème de la crème | Digital Marketing Strategist | MBA Candidate
recommendationsReceived.relation: Murielle worked with Nikhil in different groups
recommendationsReceived.content: I had met Nikhil at HPAIR Sydney conference in 2017. Since then I had the pleasure of knowing him and I had been discussing my ideas and thoughts with him.  Nikhil Jain is an inspirational and resourceful entrepreneur who loves to help others to get right connections and tools.  He’s a reliable and humble teammate who always give feasible and practical advice based on the right problems and situation.  He’s a diligent and brave researcher who devotes himself entirely to his study & research in geomechanics.

recommendationsReceived.name: Tamanna H.
recommendationsReceived.headline: Interested in Research Work, collaborations & future Opportunities.
recommendationsReceived.relation: Tamanna was senior to Nikhil but didn’t manage directly
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is an extraordinary critical thinker, solutions oriented & responsible person to start with.With an impressive background & being a well connected professional, he always takes the time to support anyone in his network.I feel, one could simply reach out to Nikhil for any matter as he holds a profound opinion based on his impeccable knowledge.My good wishes for the success he deserve in the career path.

recommendationsReceived.name: Greeshma Polkam
recommendationsReceived.headline: Research & Product @ Tala
recommendationsReceived.relation: Greeshma reported directly to Nikhil
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is a very well structured mentor. He guides and lets you innovate your way through your tasks. I found him to be very intruding with his approach towards the company's mission. His support, act of delegation and constant motivation made my focus and efficiency in this rather new field of media better.

recommendationsReceived.name: Amit Grover
recommendationsReceived.headline: CEO at AHA Taxis, India's largest outstation taxi venture
recommendationsReceived.relation: Amit was Nikhil’s mentor
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is very diligent and completely devoted to projects he is assigned to. All the best, Amit

recommendationsReceived.name: Ujjwal Kumar
recommendationsReceived.headline: Entrepreneur | Android Developer | StartUp Process Setup | UI/ UX validation
recommendationsReceived.relation: Nikhil worked with Ujjwal in the same group
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil has worked as a Digital Marketing Associate at ShopsUp for 3 months. He had joined the company when company was in very early and immature stage and took the marketing responsibility in a very aggressive and path forwarding manner. For his period of contract, i found him very enthusiastic, honest and dedicated. His work also include generating new creative ideas to market the product and reach out to target segment in a best possible and cost effective way. I would definitely recommend him for similar role.

recommendationsReceived.name: Prateek Patel
recommendationsReceived.headline: Sales & Marketing- Head at Steel Trading
recommendationsReceived.relation: Prateek was senior to Nikhil but didn’t manage directly
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil has been the go to guy( "The DigiMan for Marketing") for any solution related to digital marketing. His thought process behind every campaigns have been meaningful using right set of channels in SEO and Social Media Marketing. He is mixed blend of techno-craft + evangelist that makes him a perfect marketeer when it comes to strategic executions.  His understanding and crafting strategies to deal with performance and mobile marketing campaigns have been phenomenal.  I have seen many digital marketing executives, but only few are worthy to named and branded. I count Nikhil among those few who have the passion and fire to rip/burn the digital market through their ideas and actions.

recommendationsReceived.name: Mark S. Babbitt
recommendationsReceived.headline: Leadership and Career Mentor, Blogger, Speaker and Author
recommendationsReceived.relation: Mark S. managed Nikhil directly
recommendationsReceived.content: It’s rare that you come across young, driven talent like Nikhil Jain.  I’ve had the pleasure of working with Nikhil for most of 2015 at YouTern; we’ve collaborated on several efforts to increase traffic and marketshare at YouTern.com. He is an excellent resource for our team, and an outstanding reverse mentor to me.  I am consistently impressed by Nikhil’s ability to handle tough projects. Not only does he take full ownership, he is assertive when required and patient when necessary. It was for that reason we brought on Nikhil at our sister site, SwitchandShift.com.  Any employer would be lucky to have Nikhil as a team member.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jeet Parekh
recommendationsReceived.headline: Investment Professional • IIT BHU • CFA L2 Candidate • FRM Part 1 Cleared • Venture Capital
recommendationsReceived.relation: Jeet reported directly to Nikhil
recommendationsReceived.content: In a plethora of start-ups trying to be launched in the college, there are only a few which keep running for more than 1 year. And, EditEngine is one of them, thanks to this person. The amount of hardwork and commitment he puts up is commendable. Besides his own dedication, what is worth praising is how he handles his team members and keeps inspiring them from time to time ensuring that work is carried out at a great pace without being a burden on any of them.

recommendationsReceived.name: Layak Singh
recommendationsReceived.headline: Founder @ Artivatic | Solving Insurance Myths | xFounder @3 Startups | Hiring for Tech & Sales Role
recommendationsReceived.relation: Layak managed Nikhil directly
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is hard working and serious about his work and finishes on time with full passion. He knows what he is doing and focus on his goal. He will surely will be an asset for any organization if joins. All the best.

recommendationsReceived.name: Sunjay Sunjay
recommendationsReceived.headline: Ph.D. Research Scholar at GEOPHYSICS,BHU,VARANASI-221005,INDIA
recommendationsReceived.relation: Nikhil worked with Sunjay in the same group
recommendationsReceived.content: I have worked with Nikhil for the past one and half years as a senior researcher. I feel that Nikhil is highly qualified as a student level researcher in the sector of Mining, Petroleum and geosciences for academic knowledge, mathematical modeling and similar other reasons. Nikhil is an important contributor to many of my papers. He consistently delivers high quality work, meet deadlines, and assists others at every opportunity.Recently, when we were under an especially strict timeline on a technical book chapter, he worked a lot of overtime to ensure the work was done in time maintaining the standards of the published chapter and book.

recommendationsReceived.name: Saksham Gupta, CMIT
recommendationsReceived.headline: ME Construction Management || Seeking full-time opportunities in Project Management and Analytics ||Texas A&M University
recommendationsReceived.relation: Nikhil worked with Saksham in the same group
recommendationsReceived.content: In a plethora of start-ups trying to be launched in the college, there are only a few which keep running for more than 1 year. And, EditEngine is one of them, thanks to this person. The amount of hardwork and commitment he puts up is commendable. Besides his own dedication, what is worth praising is how he handles his team members and keeps inspiring them from time to time ensuring that work is carried out at a great pace without being a burden on any of them. EditEngine has surely created a significant impact not only in our college, but in other colleges as well and there is surely no stopping up of this unique and exciting venture.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jacob Shetty
recommendationsReceived.headline: Director at International Centre for Culture & Education
recommendationsReceived.relation: Jacob was a client of Nikhil’s
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil has worked hard with his colleges to implement in the Objectives of Rio+21

recommendationsReceived.name: Khinika Sardana
recommendationsReceived.headline: Branch Manager at Union Bank of India
recommendationsReceived.relation: Khinika was Nikhil’s mentor
recommendationsReceived.content: Nikhil is an efficient and hardworking person. He is full of energy and very much proactive. He carves out his own way to solve any problem and is dedicated towards his work. He would be a great asset to any company which is looking forward to hire him.

recommendationsGiven.name: Sushant Shekhar
recommendationsGiven.headline: Helping companies recruit faster with Bots
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil worked with Sushant in different groups
recommendationsGiven.content: Sushant is a creative and truly Entrepreneurial fellow when it comes to problem solving.  As a person, he is friendly, helpful and resourceful. I have had met him once in Delhi and with our limited but quality day long discussion, he took the key parts and worked out a problem and build a solution- TalkyJobs. In our next meeting, which was for 2 weeks at Shenzhen during APIA, he had been a great individual to know about. He had helped not only his team but also my team and many other teams with his technical skills to solve problems in product and website or app development. He is a humble person who believes in helping people in genuine needs for good. I would recommend start-ups, students and even companies to have partnerships, Mentorship or consulting respectively with him to get the best of the knowledge and skills advantage.

recommendationsGiven.name: Jorge Nunez
recommendationsGiven.headline: Analyst at noventic group
recommendationsGiven.relation: Jorge worked with Nikhil in the same group
recommendationsGiven.content: Jorge Nunez is a person who can establish good connection with people quickly because of extremely good behaviour, open nature and kindness. I have had the pleasure of meeting him at Global Entrepreneurship Summer School in Shanghai. There in he was my team leader and was also my assigned roommate. He is not sincere but also dedicated to the team goals and success. He is helpful in sharing the problems of the team and devising solutions for team's success. As a natural leader, he believes to push the team to perform at the best and thus achieves maximum output for a greater outcome. With his technical and management skills combined due to his education, he had been a great resource to the team PHABIO. It was his understanding which led the team to step towards solving a very critical and huge problem of plastic waste in online good delivery in China. As a person, I came to know home better in a short span of time. It was amazing to know about his social initiatives to help children using football as a medium of meeting them. With him comes not only the skill-set of problem solving and leadership but also the trait of handling people and strength of steering through problems to goals. I strongly believe that Jorge is a great asset to any company working towards problem solving and care about the people.

recommendationsGiven.name: Dheeraj Tommandru
recommendationsGiven.headline: Data Analyst at Genpact
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil was senior to Dheeraj but didn’t manage directly
recommendationsGiven.content: Dheeraj is a jovial and dedicated individual. He is having good understanding of data science and some related technology but also he is having a quick learning ability which had helped him to work in a team and also contribute in business aspects also. I believe he is a great individual to have in any high performing team.

recommendationsGiven.name: Silvia Chilet Jorge
recommendationsGiven.headline: CFO at Yased.Lab. Young Leader to the UNCTAD Youth Forum 2018. BBA and Law Graduate.
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil worked with Silvia in different groups
recommendationsGiven.content: I have known Silvia from APIA (Asia Pacific Innovation Academy).  She had been a dedicated and helpful delegate in the program. Her project was really good and have great potential to help the foreign tourists.  I was impressed by her ideation and business thoughts for her project.

recommendationsGiven.name: Anzhela Rudenko
recommendationsGiven.headline: Partnerships Project Manager at Weblium| Digital Women 2020 Initiative
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil worked with Anzhela but at different companies
recommendationsGiven.content: Anzhela Rudeno is an informed and extremely passionate entrepreneur. She literally put in heart and soul while working on her venture idea during Asia Pacific Innovation Academy. She had been a very helpful person during our idea validation. With her comes a good varied set of experiences and information, which she provides with great interest for helping others. I believe Anzhela will be a great leader in future and a fantastic individual to work with. She will be a true entrepreneur and a note-worthy addition to the organization she will be a part of.

recommendationsGiven.name: Mads Bering
recommendationsGiven.headline: Business Development Engineer | Game Changer | Optimization Mindset | Tech Enthusiast
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil worked with Mads in different groups
recommendationsGiven.content: Mads is a in interesting entrepreneur with an endless passion to pursue in innovation and business development. I have had the opportunity to meet Mads at Asia Pacific Innovation Academy in Shenzhen. The team he was a part of had also won the event and I would congratulate Mads for his good contributions to the fantastic venture idea they came up with. As a person, I have found Mads to be very humble, informed, helpful and sharp in skills. I believe he can be a part and even lead teams at organizations he will be working with, in future. I can totally vouch for his skills and passion towards the thing he loves to do as I have seen his efforts during 3 weeks of the program in Shenzhen. I wish Mads a very prosperous future and I totally believe he will be great asset to any company he will be hired for.

recommendationsGiven.name: Ashutosh Kumar
recommendationsGiven.headline: Delegate @MIT Bootcamps | Summer school student @Oxford University | Intern@IIM | Delegate@APIA China
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil worked with Ashutosh in different groups
recommendationsGiven.content: Ashutosh is a sincere and dedicated individual. I have had the pleasure of knowing him from past 4 months and he had impressed me with his thoughts, entrepreneurial passion, and social interactions. I have also worked with him in different group at APIA in Shenzhen and have seem him leading his team from the front and have had experienced ups & downs but always held his nerves. This managed to get the highest possible customers for his Startup in a very short span of time. He is a keen learner and aspires to become a visionary in technology. He will be a great help for organizations who wish to lead in technology front.

recommendationsGiven.name: Neeraj Joshi
recommendationsGiven.headline: Entrepreneur | Writer | Pushstarter
recommendationsGiven.relation: Neeraj worked with Nikhil in the same group
recommendationsGiven.content: Neeraj is a passionate Entrepreneur who have had seen the struggle in Entrepreneurship but had fought against the odds to come up with his World class community called PushStart.  Let me tell you this- it was his huge initial effort and endless passion to help upcoming, struggling or misguided Entrepreneurs. Thus had excited more educated ones in the community to come together and form this valuable & growing family of Entrepreneurs at Pushstart.  Now with a huge community of PushStart Neeraj had envisioned a big future for the entire Entrepreneurial community and other People with his ideas- PushTalent, PushMeetup, PushInterviews, PushAMAs, and more.  If one needs to learn community building, I would recommend Neeraj to be the right Mentor for the purpose.

recommendationsGiven.name: Malkhan Thakur
recommendationsGiven.headline: Business Analyst at Novartis, Studied at IIT (BHU) Varanasi
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil was Malkhan’s mentor
recommendationsGiven.content: Malkhan is a humble individual and a dedicated person in his professional career. He is not jus professionally good but also maintains a healthy relationships with his peers and I am happy to have been his senior in college. He is a sharp and honest person who does execute tasks with team efforts.

recommendationsGiven.name: Aaron Ho
recommendationsGiven.headline: IT Project Manager | Software Developer | Tech Enthusiast | Optimization Mindset
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil worked with Aaron in different groups
recommendationsGiven.content: Aaron is a wonderful person in terms of communication and work ethics. He is a passionate and keen entrepreneur who is also a jovial person to interact with. I have had the opportunity to meet and interact and work beside Aaron in other group for 4 weeks. Not only with his critical questioning abilities but also with his patience as listener, I have seen him as a fantastic team player. I believe Aaron is a right fit for organizations or companies who look out for a passionate individual with a strong critical thinking abilities.

recommendationsGiven.name: Randeep Singh
recommendationsGiven.headline: Looking for Summer internship opportunity in Chemical Engineering
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil managed Randeep directly
recommendationsGiven.content: Randeep is a sincere fellow. He is very honest and upfront with the work. During his internship at ForeignAdmits, he started from the very basic level of market research but then he paced up quickly using his learning from Coursera and other resources. He is a humble person and a good listener. He does ask a lot of questions to be able to understand the problem for finding a better solution, like he had done while doing the research of customers on Quora. The excellent thing about him that he pivots in planning faster for improvement in results and with limited resources also he can try and get the optimal results.  I believe he can be a great asset to organisation and with some training he can do well in his future jobs.

recommendationsGiven.name: Saurabh Pruthi
recommendationsGiven.headline: Economics Undergrad at SRCC | Ex- Delegate - HPAIR | Head - SRCC Business Conclave
recommendationsGiven.relation: Saurabh worked with Nikhil in the same group
recommendationsGiven.content: Saurabh is a jovial yet hardworking focussed person. He has been inclined towards for EQ which makes me him a better person. He worked efficiently in team at H-PAIR

recommendationsGiven.name: Abhijeet More
recommendationsGiven.headline: ABB Solar Inverter | Solar Power Passionate™ | Active Contributor for National Mission 175GW By Renewable Energy
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil worked with Abhijeet but at different companies
recommendationsGiven.content: Abhijeet as I know is passionate about solar and spreads awareness related to solar. I remember once one of my friend wanted an solution regarding solar then that time Abhijeet has supported my friend with connecting to responsible person.  He is passionate about solar energy and related solutions and is working on very promising ideas.

recommendationsGiven.name: Gitika Bhatia
recommendationsGiven.headline: Founder @AarGee Group | Exporter of Apparel & Home Furnishings | Sales & Marketing Advisor | Social Entrepreneur | Passionate Speaker & Writer | #ONO always
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil managed Gitika directly
recommendationsGiven.content: Gitika is a wonderful person and a hard-working individual. She brings to table on most discussions- implementable growth ideas, good business networking strategies and an endless enthusiasm to push the team ahead.  She is tech savvy girl and I believe she will be a good addition to any team, talking business or growth.

recommendationsGiven.name: Pratyush Choudhury
recommendationsGiven.headline: Product Management | Data Science | Hult Prize - Top 6 | Technology & Business Enthusiast | Pfizer | Reckitt Benckiser
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil was Pratyush’s mentor
recommendationsGiven.content: I have been mentoring Pratyush for over a year now and I am absolutely amazed by the progress he has made. He has always questioned the existing norms of the college and challenged the status-quo.  He is an extremely passionate learner of business and has been actively writing excellent articles on Business on Medium and Quora.  He has been consistently working at a tempo that is exceeding expectations and with age on his side, he will surely go on to become that person that you can't afford to miss out from your team / company.

recommendationsGiven.name: Shivam Sharma
recommendationsGiven.headline: Data for Policy | Social Enterprises | Rural Development | IIT Bombay PG | Ex-PRADAN | Pantnagar UG
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil managed Shivam directly
recommendationsGiven.content: Shivam is an excellent person and is one of the good student I have met in IIT Bombay. With a humble nature and down to earth personality, he has been very good in his work and skills. He has been quite motivating to me due to his Interest and work towards Rural development. I had the pleasure of working with him while leading the team as Overall Coordinator for a National level Research Confluence- ReSConAm'17 at IIT BOMBAY. There was appointed as a manager for events and he also handled technical part of fest and also some organisational moments in a efficient manner. I see him becoming a good leader in future and contributing for changing lives of villagers for good.

recommendationsGiven.name: Suprabhat D.
recommendationsGiven.headline: Technical Supervisor and Growth Initiator | PyTorch Udacity Scholar | Overleaf Advisor
recommendationsGiven.relation: Suprabhat worked with Nikhil in the same group
recommendationsGiven.content: Suprabhat is a talented Individual and always seeks to learn to add value to community. He has am Entrepreneurial zeal and Interest and in this young age, having a consistent focus on work, he will be achieving bigger moments in life. I had the Experience of meeting him online for my Venture and found him talented too. Soon he had to take a leave from my Venture due to his immense Interest in starting one on his own for solving some problems he feels that needs to be solved. He is an good multitasker and can be a good value creator to venture he become a part of.

recommendationsGiven.name: Ankur Parmar
recommendationsGiven.headline: PGP Student at Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode | Mahindra | IIT (BHU) Varanasi
recommendationsGiven.relation: Ankur worked with Nikhil in the same group
recommendationsGiven.content: Ankur is a honest and creative person. I had the opportunity to guide and mentor him for his contributions to my 1st Venture, where he had put in efforts for countlesly. He had been a good strategic person and needed some guidance and market exposure to help our Venture (EditEngine) to grow locally and nationally.  As my junior, he had been a good fellow too. We had a good professional bonding even.

recommendationsGiven.name: Saksham Gupta, CMIT
recommendationsGiven.headline: ME Construction Management || Seeking full-time opportunities in Project Management and Analytics ||Texas A&M University
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil was Saksham’s mentor
recommendationsGiven.content: Saksham has been one of the most hardworking and dedicated member of Edit Engine. From being the first member to join to turning as one of the co founding members of Edit Engine was really commendable. Time management and leadership are a few traits that are naturally imbibed within him. Not only did he finish the projects meticulously but he was also instrumental in bringing and leading a group of editors at the college. I would myself love to have him working with me sometime in the future as well as strongly recommend his candidature to companies looking to acquire flawless talent. Wishing him all the best for all his future endeavours. I personally feel that his involvement with any organzation or startup will be a great asset to them and will bring a good sense of positivity to the culture of the company or group.

recommendationsGiven.name: Abhishek Yadav
recommendationsGiven.headline: IIT || NbliK || CIL
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil and Abhishek were students together
recommendationsGiven.content: I've studied alongside Abhishek for close to two years as his senior in college at IIT BHU. In those two years, I've seen him not only excel at the core elements of his academics -- like mining -- but also learn other valuable skills and pursue his passion of Entrepreneurship that extend well beyond the scope of his role, like Startups, marketing, operations and even championing in his first venture to fair extent.

recommendationsGiven.name: Akram Pathan - SEO Expert and Digital Marketing Consultant Ahmedabad

recommendationsGiven.content: It was wonderful to work together with Akram Pathan, who is an excellent SEO Specialist. When you really get to connect with him, you'll find a fantastic person with unique skills! Loyal, insightful and independent as the core quality you would find in him but that's not all. He is result driven, experienced and efficient team player. Deliver results and move ahead. That's Akram Pathan's way. I would like to thank for things I learned about SEO Consultation, I learned from Akram Pathan. He is an asset to any business.

recommendationsGiven.name: Greeshma Polkam
recommendationsGiven.headline: Research & Product @ Tala
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil was Greeshma’s mentor
recommendationsGiven.content: Greeshma is a versatile entrepreneur and a good learner. She is a budding entrepreneur, a creative strategist in marketing and business development. Additionally, she has done a series of small favors for me in the process, showing her sincerity and generosity while helping me with viral marketing ideas. As a team member during ConneXTech, Greeshma earns my highest recommendation for being a true hustler, dedicated person and true to her work

recommendationsGiven.name: Nishant Shukla
recommendationsGiven.headline: Junior undergraduate at IIT(BHU), Varanasi
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil managed Nishant directly
recommendationsGiven.content: Dedicated crafty hustler is the term that comes to mind when I think about Nishant. I’ve had the pleasure of knowing Nishant for 4 years of college life, during which he have been a good learner, idea innovator and excellent negotiator. Above all, I was impressed with Nishant’s ability to draft some excellent content for my first start-up, EditEngine. And, of course, his writing and creativity skills have been phenomenol. Nishant would be a true asset for any positions requiring creative content writer or social media blogger or operations executive and comes with my heartfelt recommendation.

recommendationsGiven.name: Harshal Dhoke
recommendationsGiven.headline: Assistant Vice President at State Bank of India
recommendationsGiven.relation: Nikhil managed Harshal directly
recommendationsGiven.content: Harshal is a dedicated and goal oriented person with high aspiration and hold a good hustler attitude in achieving targets. Working with him, was a great experience and he has been a reverse mentor to me at times. His sales and marketing acumen is quite sharp to bring in good results in short span of time.

projects.title: Mine Closure Planning : Indian perspective
projects.description: Under aegis of Dr. N.C. Karmakar, pursuing a project on analysis of mine closure planning in India and its up-gradations and suitable changes for better output. Included: FMEA and Risk analysis for underground and open cast mines.

projects.title: Using design thinking to create better waste segregation practices in cities
projects.description: We expected to make a triplet of dustbin with differentiators like colour, name and sensors to sense and indicate users about the right garbage to be put in right Bin. We also gamified the process using correctness meter and have community leaderboard. We ideated to use proximity detection sensors, water, plastic, metal detectors along with filling indicators. We will be making the rouogh prototype using red-bull cans, paints, cutters, rapes, papers, sticks and markers.  If we can build a prototype dustbin based on the available paper based food wrappers as covering of the body of dustbin. And also place on top of the brim of bin a sample of what needs to be put inside it. We will thus build a dustbin using the Paper bags given in lunch food packet and using them as a wrapping material around a dustbin. Also placing one paper bag (in vertically standing position) on the brim.  Making Bins smarter and interactive for to have waste segregation at the source and also incentivise them coupons/ points to dump right waste in right bins. All these bins will be deployed at the right spots like petrol pumps, college coffee shops, airports, etc.

projects.title: 3-Dimensional (3D) modelling of fracture propagation in hydraulic fracturing using COMSOL Multiphysics
projects.description: Guide: Dr. Vikram Vishal, Asst. Professor , Dept of Earth Sciences, IIT Roorkee  1.Development of models of hydraulic fracturing fracture propagation in ideal and realistic conditions on cap rock stability of different kinds of shale and oil reservoirs like permian, bakken and also Indian.  2. Analysis of the changes in properties of rock and its behavior of shale reservoirs in India on injection pressure variation from 20 Mpa to 8 Mpa.  3.Study of the variation of fracture propagation and stress points in geometry of fractures on varied influential parameters like injection pressure, pore pressure, friction angle (angle of internal friction), cohesive forces, permeability, porosity and in situ stresses.  4.Thus generation of a report and completed a paper based on model results and theoretical study of Indian and foreign conditions of shale reservoir stability and behavior of varied parameter affecting fracture propagation.

projects.title: Google Online Marketing Challenge
projects.description: The major aim of the Google AdWords campaign for Switch and Shift was to spread awareness about their consulting services and the book ‘A World Gone Social’. The campaign was run for 18 days and accounted to $ 254.24. We created 4 Ad Groups in 3 campaigns. It was reported that over 5 lakhs impressions (5037.6% of assumed), 1249 clicks (416.33% of assumed), $0.20 average Cost Per Click. WTMP (Work That Matters Podcast), the average position of this Ad was 1st throughout the campaign. The company managed to get, till then biggest client just after the campaign and even closed in two more deals

projects.title: Analysis of behavior of physico-mechanical properties of Indian shale
projects.description: Guide: Dr. T.N. Singh, Professor, Dept of Earth Sciences, IIT Bombay.  Pursued laboratory experiments involving uniaxial compression testing machine and P-wave velocity finding machine and even compared the laboratory generated results with results from numerical modelling done on COMSOL multiphysics. Data sets taken were of real conditions of Indian shale reservoirs.

projects.title: Noise level mapping in an opencast coal mine: a case study on Dudhichua project, Northern Coalfields Ltd., Singrauli
projects.description: • Field visit to Dudhichua project at NCL, Singrauli. • Marking and plotting areas and points of noise frequency on a mine map (including mining operations and mining machineries) • Data collection with the help of noise dosimeter (Type 4445E). • Plotting contours of noise levels after processing the data for time weighted average for a reference time of 8 hrs shift. • Suggesting suitable remedies for the miners and staff members present at the mine site.

projects.title: Optimization of fracture propagation behavior in Indian shale reservoir by three dimensional modeling using COMSOL Multiphysics
projects.description: Under guidance of Dr. T.N. Singh I have pursued this project using COMSOL Multiphysics and laboratory experiments for Indian conditions of shale reservoir.

projects.title: Geophysical Study of Gas Hydrate Stability
projects.description: The Methane Hydrate monitoring station consists of three types of observing systems: geochemical, microbial and seismo-acoustic. Hydrate occurs within sediments. The high resolution seismo-acoustics allows to recognize the gas-charged sediments beneath the seabed through several intra-sedimentary acoustic features. It reveals the characteristic of the "gassy" intra-sedimentary features which cannot be seen in the low resolution seismic reflection record.  Seismo-acoustic method is employed to methane hydrate and oil reservoir detection and characterization. Methane hydrate (white gold) is a crystal fuel which releases 164 unit volume of methane gas from one unit volume of gas hydrate. Hydrate dissociation could be critical in inciting slope failures for low permeability sediments in shallow water depths. Since gas hydrates are located on the continental slope and – if present in sufficient amounts – may increase sediment strength, their dissociation influences slope stability.Gas hydrates and submarine slope stability, exploring the role of gas hydrates in triggering and/or propagating submarine mass movements is pertinent task before geo-scientist. Biochemical reveals the impact of the stability, structure, and gas composition of the gas hydrate. In fact, methano genesis is indirectly involved in the formation of a highly abundant form of gas hydrates on earth- biogenic methane hydrate. Biochemical reaction and diffusion in seafloor gas hydrate capillaries affects the gas hydrate stability. Biochemical reactions occur within gas hydrate accumulations providing a driving force for diffusion of organic and inorganic components in and out of gas hydrate interior. Study of GHSZ shows transport phenomenon which affects the gas hydrate stability in multiple ways, depending on the biochemical reactions occurring. Seismic imaging by wavelet transform provides precise cause of slope stability

projects.title: PEM Fuel Cells: Demand Development and Challenges in Indian energy scenario
projects.description: Polymer Electrolyte Membrane fuel cell or PEM fuel cell, a promising outcome from the research of people due to demand of energy in world during energy deficiency. The aim of this project is to discuss the benefits of using PEM fuel cell in mining on the basis of cost effectiveness, energy saving and efficiency.

The paper is intended to show the impact, benefits and crisis situations regarding depletion of fossil fuel energy in India.

publications.name: Three dimensional modelling of propagation of hydraulic fractures in shale at different injection pressures
publications.description: Sustain. Environ. Res., 25(4), 217-225 (2015) http://ser.cienve.org.tw/ KEY WORDS 3D modelling, hydraulic fractures, shale, COMSOL Multiphysics  ABSTRACT  The modeling of conjugate development of fractures and fluid flow remains a significant subject in a diversity of rock engineering. Continuum numerical methods are paramount in the modeling of rock engineering practice problems, merely with restrained capacities in modeling the problem of fracture development coupled by fluid flow. There exists a demand for them to be understood in details. Driven by this, we demonstrated an approach based on a three-dimensional development of fracture of an abstract model condensed to two-dimensional analysis comprising rocks with fractures. In the framework of a continuum method of modeling, the contact between the fracture development and deformation was paired with fluid flow. A 3-D model was established in this case for a shale reservoir and fluid was injected at multiple pressures to understand the initiation and propagation of fractures, as applied to the field of hydraulic fracturing. The stress, strain, displacement in the reservoir were monitored at multiple injection pressures. Linear relations of injection pressures were observed with these parameters. A detailed insight with quantification of the values is given into the subject based on the findings of this study.

publications.name: Shale Gas: An Unconventional Gas Reservoir
publications.description: DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.1.1975.2805  Abstract: With a view to energy security of the world, unconventional energy resources - coalbed methane (CBM) , Methane Gas Hydrate, shale gas, basin centred gas ,tight gas, oil shale and heavy oil- exploration and exploitation is pertinent task before geoscientist . Shale gas is natural gas from shale formations which acts as both the source and the reservoir for the natural gas. Each Shale gas reservoir has unique characteristics. Shale has low matrix permeability, so gas production in commercial quantities requires fractures to provide permeability. For a given matrix permeability and pressure, gas production are determined by the number and complexity of fractures created, their effective conductivity, and the ability to effectively reduce the pressure throughout the fracture network to initiate gas production. Understanding the relationship between fracture complexity, fracture conductivity, matrix permeability, and gas recovery is a fundamental challenge of shale-gas development. Shale gas reservoirs almost always have two different storage volumes (dual porosity) for hydrocarbons, the rock matrix and the natural fractures .

It reveals the characteristic of the "gassy" intra-sedimentary features which cannot be seen in the low resolution seismic reflection record.  Seismo-acoustic method is employed to methane hydrate and oil reservoir detection and characterization. Methane hydrate (white gold) is a crystal fuel which releases 164 unit volume of methane gas from one unit volume of gas hydrate. Hydrate dissociation could be critical in inciting slope failures for low permeability sediments in shallow water depths. Since gas hydrates are located on the continental slope and – if present in sufficient amounts – may increase sediment strength, their dissociation influences slope stability.Gas hydrates and submarine slope stability, exploring the role of gas hydrates in triggering and/or propagating submarine mass movements is pertinent task before geo-scientist. Biochemical reveals the impact of the stability, structure, and gas composition of the gas hydrate. In fact, methano genesis is indirectly involved in the formation of a highly abundant form of gas hydrates on earth- biogenic methane hydrate. Biochemical reaction and diffusion in seafloor gas hydrate capillaries affects the gas hydrate stability. publications.name: Polymer Electrolyte Membrane Fuel Cells : Alternative to fossil fuels for power supply to Heavy Earth Moving and Allied Machinery in Mining and Civil Engineering Industry
publications.description: DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.1.3482.6086  Abstract: Today, we are faced with the dual challenges of the environmental pollution and a severe energy crisis. The need of the hour is to develop newer, environmental friendly technologies to generate clean energy. PEM Fuel Cell Technology is one such promising eco-technology. PEM Fuel Cells have been used to power transportation vehicles, telecommunication stations, etc. Use of PEM Fuel Cells to power heavy machinery in mining and civil engineering industry will be a major breakthrough in reducing our dependence on fossil fuels and driving our industries and society towards eco-technological orientation.

(B.H.U.), Varanasi-221005 and (2) Entrepreneur, Experienced Professional in Commodity trading, Derivatives Structuring and Business development,  Presented a Technical poster on ' Guar gum in Hydraulic Fracturing in Indian Shale Mines' in a national Seminar- Behind the teacher's desk, in Tatanagar, in collaboration with CSIR Jamshedpur, National Metallurgical Lab Jamshedpur and Tata Steel.

publications.name: Guar Gum in Hydraulic Fracturing in Indian Shale Mines
publications.publisher: Department of Mining Engineering, IIT (BHU) Varanasi
publications.description: DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.1.2085.8725 Conference Paper: Guar Gum in Hydraulic Fracturing in Indian Shale Mines Nikhil Jain, Khushboo Garg, N C Karmakar, S K Palei  Abstract: Guar, a small bean grown in Indian subcontinent has become a prized international commodity, since the rise of Hydraulic Fracturing on international level. The intent of this paper is to introduce this efficient Hydraulic fracturing technology in the extraction of shale gas and few oils too, considering the vast shale deposit as well as guar in India, opening the vast unassessed energy reserve.  Presented in "Present Technology and Safety Scenario in Mining and Allied Industries", a national symposium by Department of Mining Engineering, IIT (BHU) Varanasi
